issues: HTML renderer is deprecated (Flutter 3.27+) and will be removed (Flutter 3.29+) - lesson presents it as current option
Flutter 3.22+ should be updated to 3.24+ as the recommended minimum for Wasm
The Wasm renderer description is inaccurate - Flutter uses 'skwasm' renderer for Wasm builds, not a separate 'Wasm renderer'
Browser version for Safari incorrectly states 18+ (Sep 2024) - Safari/WebKit still does NOT support WasmGC fully
Firefox 120+ listed but there's a known limitation that prevents it from working properly with Flutter Wasm
recommendations: Remove HTML renderer as a current option and add note about its deprecation
Clarify the renderer architecture: builds can be 'default' or 'wasm', and renderers are 'canvaskit' or 'skwasm'
Update browser compatibility to accurately reflect Safari/iOS limitation (WebKit doesn't support WasmGC)
Add note about Firefox known limitations

gaps: No explanation of WasmGC (garbage collection) requirement and why it matters
No mention of dart:html/package:js deprecation and migration to package:web/dart:js_interop
Missing explanation of multi-threading support in Wasm builds
No mention of iOS browser limitation (all iOS browsers use WebKit which lacks WasmGC support)
recommendations: Add ANALOGY section comparing rendering modes to different video playback methods
Add WARNING section about browser compatibility and iOS limitations
Explain WasmGC requirement and its impact on browser support
Add section about JS interop migration requirements for Wasm compatibility

outdatedItems: HTML renderer presented as viable option (deprecated in 3.27, removed in 3.29)
Browser compatibility percentages may be outdated
2024+ recommendation should be updated to 2025+ context
recommendations: Update to reflect HTML renderer deprecation and CanvasKit as default
Clarify skwasm vs canvaskit distinction for Wasm builds
Update browser support table with accurate Safari/iOS status
Add note about Flutter 3.35 hot reload improvements for web

missingPrerequisites: What WebAssembly actually is and why it matters
Basic understanding of browser rendering engines
Concept of garbage collection in programming
unansweredQuestions: How do I know if my app/packages are compatible with Wasm?
What happens if a user visits with an unsupported browser?
How much faster is Wasm really - are there benchmarks?
Does Wasm affect SEO differently than HTML renderer did?
missingUseCases: Migration path from existing HTML-based Flutter web apps
Hybrid apps that need both mobile and web
recommendations: Add brief WebAssembly primer for developers unfamiliar with it
Include real benchmark numbers (2x startup improvement cited by Flutter team)
Add decision tree for choosing between CanvasKit and Wasm builds

shortSections.recommendation: Expand with actual benchmark numbers and comparison data

suggestedNewContent.title: Browser and Platform Limitations
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Cover iOS limitation (all browsers use WebKit which lacks WasmGC), Firefox known issues, and fallback behavior when WasmGC unavailable

suggestedNewContent.title: HTML Renderer Deprecation Notice
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Explain that HTML renderer is deprecated in Flutter 3.27+ and removed in 3.29+. Describe migration path to CanvasKit or Wasm builds

suggestedNewContent.title: Understanding Rendering Modes
suggestedNewContent.contentOutline: Compare rendering modes to video formats: HTML like streaming video (lightweight, compatible), CanvasKit like downloaded HD video (consistent quality), Wasm like native app (best performance)
